name: Amritsar
fun_fact: Fun fact: The Golden Temple's langar (community kitchen) is the world's largest, serving 100,000+ free meals DAILY to anyone regardless of background, beliefs, or religion. Everyone sits on the floor together eating simple dal, roti, rice, and kheerâ€”a profound expression of equality and community that's been running for centuries.

hero_dishes.name: Amritsari Kulcha
hero_dishes.description: Legendary crisp, butter-laden flatbread stuffed with spiced potatoes, cauliflower, paneer, or mixed vegetables, served with spicy chickpeas (chole) and tangy tamarind chutney
hero_dishes.origin_story: In 1952, Pehalwan Atma Ram, a professional wrestler in his sixties, took the concept of Peshawari khameeri roti (sourdough naan) and transformed it into Amritsari kulcha at his shop in Dhab Khatikan, Walled City. He pioneered the crispy, buttery technique that defines the dish today.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Kesar Da Dhaba (100+ years old, near Golden Temple), Kulcha Land, Bhai Kulwant Singh Kulchian Wale (near Golden Templeâ€”5 varieties including gobhi, paneer, aloo, mixed veg, and pithi), Bharawan Da Dhaba (near Town Hall)

hero_dishes.name: Golden Temple Langar
hero_dishes.description: Free community meal of dal, roti, rice, and kheer served to tens of thousands daily at the Golden Temple
hero_dishes.origin_story: Made with love and served to all regardless of background, the langar embodies Sikh principles of seva (service) and equality. It's counted among the world's most extensive community kitchens, feeding pilgrims, travelers, and locals alike.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Golden Templeâ€”sit on the floor among pilgrims and experience a profoundly humbling meal that feeds both body and soul

hero_dishes.name: Makki Di Roti & Sarson Da Saag
hero_dishes.description: Corn flatbread with mustard greens curryâ€”quintessential Punjabi winter dish and Kesar Da Dhaba's specialty for 100 years
hero_dishes.origin_story: This traditional Punjabi combination has been Kesar Da Dhaba's signature since 1916 in Sheikhupura, Pakistan. Even Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru and Indira Gandhi packed food parcels from here. After Partition, the dhaba relocated to Amritsar.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Kesar Da Dhaba (Chowk Passian) has been serving this for 100 yearsâ€”notable figures like Lala Lajpat Rai frequented the original location

hero_dishes.name: Fish Amritsari
hero_dishes.description: Famous batter-fried fish with Punjabi spices, crispy and flavorful
hero_dishes.origin_story: Makhan Fish & Chicken Corner has been serving this delectable non-vegetarian specialty since 1962 on Lawrence Road.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Makhan Fish & Chicken Corner (Lawrence Road)â€”legendary spot operating since 1962

hero_dishes.name: Dal Makhani & Parantha
hero_dishes.description: Creamy black lentils cooked with butter and cream, served with flaky layered flatbread
hero_dishes.origin_story: Kesar Da Dhaba's dal makhani has been perfected over 100 years, representing the pinnacle of Punjabi comfort food.

signature_drinks.name: Gian Di Lassi (Peda Lassi)
signature_drinks.description: Legendary creamy yogurt drink with milk peda (sweet condensed milk cakes), sugar, malai (cream), and heavy butter churning. The phirni lassi adds rice pudding for extra richness.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Established in 1927, Gian di Lassi on Gagar Mal Road serves 6-7 varieties. Locals visit for the home-made taste topped with thick cream. The place has been operational for over 100 years, serving 'makhan maarke' (loaded with butter).

signature_drinks.name: Masala Chai
signature_drinks.description: Spicy-sweet tea with strong flavor, perfect accompaniment to samosas or pakoras
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Not just a drink but an integral part of daily life in Punjab, enjoyed throughout the day. The spicy-sweet fragrance and robust taste define Amritsari chai culture.

signature_drinks.name: Gur Gur Chai
signature_drinks.description: Distinctive drink made from jaggery and chaat masalaâ€”a unique conventional drink originating from Amritsar
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: A local Amritsar specialty combining sweet jaggery with tangy chaat masala for a unique flavor profile.

signature_drinks.name: Kesar Badam Milk
signature_drinks.description: Premium saffron-charged almond milk, sweetened with sugar or honey, decorated with almond slivers and crushed saffron threads
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: A specialty healthy beverage from Amritsar, representing the city's love for rich, luxurious dairy drinks.

food_culture_notes: Amritsar is a city where food is not just sustenance but a passion, an art, and a venerable part of its rich cultural tapestry
The tradition of seva (service) continues beyond the Golden Templeâ€”street vendors and restaurants frequently provide meals to orphanages, shelters, and gurdwaras
Dhaba culture is central: 100-year-old establishments like Kesar Da Dhaba and Bharawan Da Dhaba serve generations of families
Amritsari kulche-chhole and lassi are synonymous with the city's identity
Food culture mixes profound spirituality (langar's equality message) with legendary flavor (kulcha, lassi)
The quintessential spirit of Punjab traverses Amritsar's labyrinthine lanes and gets imbibed in the lip-smacking culinary scene
Gian Di Lassi's peda lassi and Kesar Da Dhaba's 100-year-old recipes are pilgrimage destinations for food lovers

atmosphere: Bustling dhaba culture with smoke and sizzle
Butter-laden kulcha being prepared on iron griddles
Lassi shops churning thick creamy drinks
Pilgrims and food lovers mingling in food streets
unique_modern: Gourmet kulcha variations beyond traditional potato
Fusion lassi flavors while respecting tradition
Food tours combining Punjab traditions, culture, and history
